title: Extract LICENSE.txt on first run
description: On first run of the packaged executable, extract the project's LICENSE.txt file to the application directory alongside the exe. This ensures users have easy access to license terms without needing to open the executable bundle. Implementation: Check if LICENSE.txt exists in current directory on startup. If not found and running as frozen executable, extract from bundled resources. Place LICENSE.txt in same directory as BurndownChart.exe. Log extraction for troubleshooting. Note: Third-party licenses are bundled inside the executable and accessible via PyInstaller resource system. Legal requirement is typically to make them ACCESSIBLE not necessarily extract them. They remain in bundle and can be accessed programmatically if needed. Related: Portable executable - first run acts as installation/setup.

title: Eliminate data/persistence.py circular import
description: Move facade functions from data/persistence.py to data/persistence/adapters.py to eliminate circular import with configuration module. This file is not truly legacy - it's an adapter that transforms backend data to legacy format. Moving it into the persistence package eliminates the circular dependency that breaks PyInstaller frozen executables.
notes: WIP: Moved persistence.py to data/persistence/adapters.py but still has circular import in frozen exe. Chain: configuration.settings -> logging_config -> data.installation_context -> data/__init__.py -> adapters -> configuration.settings. Need to break chain with lazy imports or move constants.

title: T054: Add graceful shutdown delay in update callback
description: In callbacks/app_update.py, add 1-second delay using threading.Timer before triggering update to allow browser notification to reach client. Return immediate alert 'Update starting... App will restart automatically.' to inform user.

title: Bug: Export does not include Settings Panel parameters
description: The export functionality does not capture Settings Panel values including: deadline, milestone, data points slider position, Estimated Items, Remaining Items, Estimated Points, Remaining Points, Points Tracking toggle. These values are lost on import.
notes: This bug exists on main branch. Fix should be developed and tested on main, then merged to feature branches. Discovered during packaging feature testing (t-034) but is unrelated to packaging functionality.

title: Extract LICENSE.txt on first run
description:
On first run of the packaged executable, extract the project's LICENSE.txt file to the application directory alongside the exe. This ensures users have easy access to license terms without needing to open the executable bundle.

Implementation:
- Check if LICENSE.txt exists in current directory on startup
- If not found and running as frozen executable, extract from bundled resources
- Place LICENSE.txt in same directory as BurndownChart.exe
- Log extraction for troubleshooting

Note: Third-party licenses are bundled inside the executable and accessible via PyInstaller's resource system. Legal requirement is typically to make them ACCESSIBLE (which they are), not necessarily extract them. They remain in the bundle and can be accessed programmatically if needed (e.g., Help -> View Licenses menu option in future).

Related: Portable executable - first run acts as installation/setup.
